turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Neustadt an der Weinstraße.
turn.1: When did Neustadt an der Weinstraße become a city?
turn.2: In 1815, Neustadt became part of the Kingdom of Bavaria until 1945, along with the rest of the Palatinate which was one of 8 Bavarian districts (Rhine District).
turn.3: What was the name of the district it was in?
turn.4: As of 1837 the district was renamed as "Pfalz".
turn.5: What is something interesting about this article?
turn.6: As a result of this resubordination, in 1818 the town became the seat of a "Landkommissariat" (called a "Bezirksamt" from 1862 and a "Landkreis" from 1939).
turn.7: Did anything happen in the city during this time?
turn.8: In 1832 the Hambach Festival took place near the town.
turn.9: Did the city have any major events happen?
turn.10: In 1847, Neustadt was connected to the railway network by the Palatine Ludwig Railway.
turn.11: Did anything happen in the city during the 1918 revolution?
turn.12: A Workers and Soldiers Council was established during the German Revolution of 1918.
